label: Data Privacy Compliance (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)
description: Automated privacy compliance management with data discovery, classification, and regulatory requirement enforcement across all systems.

traditional.workflow: Manual spreadsheet inventory of personal data across systems. Periodic privacy audits (annual or when regulations change) requiring weeks of effort. Reactive compliance - wait for regulation to pass then scramble to implement. Manual privacy impact assessments (PIAs) for new systems. Limited ability to fulfill data subject requests (access, deletion, portability) requiring IT involvement and weeks of effort.
constraints: Manual PIA process (4-8 weeks per system)
metrics: Data subject request fulfillment time: 15-30 days

agentic.workflow: AI-powered privacy compliance platform continuously scans all data stores (databases, data lakes, SaaS apps, file shares) to discover and classify personal data using machine learning and pattern recognition. Automated data flow mapping tracks how personal data moves between systems for GDPR Article 30 Records of Processing Activities (ROPA). Real-time compliance monitoring validates data handling against GDPR, CCPA, and other regulations with automated alerts for violations. Intelligent data subject request fulfillment automates 80-90% of access, deletion, and portability requests by orchestrating actions across all systems holding the subject's data. Automated Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) use questionnaires and AI analysis of data flows to generate reports. Consent management integration ensures marketing and data processing respect user preferences.
dataSources: All enterprise data stores (databases, lakes, SaaS)
benefits: Continuous personal data discovery (vs 6-12 month outdated inventory)
90-95% reduction in data subject request fulfillment time (1-3 days vs 15-30 days)
80-90% automated DSR fulfillment (vs manual IT effort)
metrics: Data subject request fulfillment time: 1-3 days
Privacy audit frequency: Continuous with quarterly reports

hitlGate.threshold: Data deletion request affecting >10,000 records or critical customer
hitlGate.policy: DPO (Data Protection Officer) approval required for high-impact deletion requests

quickWins: Deploy automated personal data discovery for top 5 systems (immediate visibility)
Implement automated GDPR access request fulfillment (80% time savings)
Enable consent management integration with marketing platforms
prerequisites: Integration with all systems storing personal data

label: Consent & Preference Management
description: Centralized consent capture, preference management, and real-time enforcement across all customer touchpoints and systems.

traditional.workflow: Consent captured at point of interaction (website checkbox, email opt-in) but stored in siloed systems. No centralized view of customer consent preferences. Manual enforcement—marketing teams must check multiple systems before sending campaigns. Consent not synchronized across channels (email consent doesn't apply to SMS). Opt-out requests processed manually via email with 7-14 day lag. Regulatory risk from inadvertent consent violations.
constraints: Frequent consent violation fines and complaints

agentic.workflow: AI-powered consent management platform provides unified preference center where customers manage all consents (marketing email, SMS, phone, data sharing, cookie preferences) in one place. Real-time consent synchronization pushes preference updates to all systems (CRM, email service provider, call center, analytics) within seconds. Automated consent enforcement validates every customer interaction against current preferences before execution—marketing campaigns, personalization, analytics. Machine learning detects consent anomalies (e.g., customer opted out but still receiving emails) and triggers alerts. Granular consent management enables purpose-specific and processing-specific permissions. Consent audit trail tracks all consent changes for regulatory compliance. Smart consent UX optimizes acceptance rates while ensuring genuine informed consent.
benefits: 10-20% improvement in opt-in rates through better UX

quickWins: Deploy centralized preference center (immediate customer control)
Implement real-time consent sync to marketing platforms (90% violation reduction)
Enable automated opt-out processing (95% time savings)
prerequisites: Integration with all marketing and analytics systems

label: Data Access Controls & Audit Logging
description: Role-based access controls with automated provisioning, real-time monitoring, and comprehensive audit trails for sensitive data.

traditional.workflow: Manual user provisioning and deprovisioning with ticket-based requests taking days. Static role assignments without consideration of data sensitivity. Limited access audit capabilities—difficult to answer 'who has access to customer PII?' Manual quarterly access reviews using spreadsheets. No real-time alerting for suspicious access patterns. Audit logs scattered across systems with limited retention.
constraints: Difficult to determine 'who can see what data'

agentic.workflow: AI-powered identity and access management (IAM) platform automates user provisioning and deprovisioning based on HR system integrations (new hire, role change, termination). Attribute-based access control (ABAC) dynamically assigns permissions based on user attributes, data sensitivity, and business context. Machine learning continuously monitors access patterns and detects anomalies (unusual time, location, data volume, or sensitivity of access). Real-time alerts for high-risk access events (accessing customer PII outside normal role). Automated periodic access reviews with AI-suggested recertification decisions based on actual usage patterns. Comprehensive audit logging captures all data access with tamper-proof retention for regulatory compliance. Self-service access request workflows with automated approval routing and time-limited access grants.
dataSources: HR system (employee data, roles, org structure)
User access patterns and behavior baselines
benefits: 90-95% reduction in provisioning time (hours vs 3-7 days)
Real-time suspicious access detection (vs reactive post-breach)
80-90% reduction in access review effort through AI suggestions
Complete audit trail with multi-year retention
metrics: Access review frequency: Continuous with quarterly formal reviews

hitlGate.threshold: Access to highly sensitive data (financials, health records, executive communications)
hitlGate.policy: Manager and security team approval required for elevated access privileges

quickWins: Implement automated user provisioning/deprovisioning via HR integration (80% time savings)
Deploy real-time access anomaly detection for PII (immediate threat visibility)
Enable centralized audit log collection and retention

label: PII Detection, Classification & Masking
description: Automated identification and protection of personally identifiable information across all data environments with dynamic masking.

traditional.workflow: Manual tagging of PII fields in databases and applications based on field names. No automated detection of unstructured PII in logs, documents, or freeform text fields. Static data masking in non-production environments created via manual SQL scripts. Developers and analysts have full access to production PII. Data exfiltration risk from unrestricted PII access.
constraints: PII detection limited to known structured fields
Static masking requires manual scripting and maintenance
Full production PII access for developers/analysts
High data breach and exfiltration risk

agentic.workflow: AI-powered data protection platform uses machine learning and natural language processing to automatically discover PII across structured databases, unstructured documents, logs, and cloud storage. Intelligent classification assigns sensitivity levels (PII, sensitive PII, confidential) based on data type and regulatory requirements. Dynamic data masking presents masked or tokenized data to unauthorized users while showing real values to privileged users—no data duplication required. Context-aware masking applies different masking strategies (redaction, pseudonymization, tokenization, encryption) based on data sensitivity and user role. Automated PII detection in application logs and developer tools prevents accidental PII exposure. Real-time alerts when new PII fields are detected in production. Secure analytics enables data scientists to work with anonymized production data.
dataSources: All enterprise data stores (databases, lakes, SaaS, files)
PII detection patterns and ML models
benefits: Real-time PII exposure prevention in logs and tools

quickWins: Deploy automated PII discovery for top 10 databases (immediate visibility)
Implement dynamic masking for non-production environments (eliminate data duplication)
Enable PII detection in application logs (prevent exposure)

label: Data Retention & Automated Archival
description: Policy-based data lifecycle management with automated archival, deletion, and legal hold enforcement for compliance and cost optimization.

traditional.workflow: Undefined or inconsistent data retention policies across business units. Data accumulates indefinitely due to 'save everything just in case' mentality. Manual ad-hoc purging efforts when storage costs spike or compliance requires deletion. Legal holds managed via email with manual tracking. Excessive data storage costs and regulatory risk from retaining data longer than required.
constraints: No formal retention policies or inconsistent enforcement
Regulatory risk from excessive data retention
metrics: Storage cost optimization: Low (retention not managed)

agentic.workflow: AI-powered data lifecycle management platform automatically classifies data based on type, sensitivity, and business value. Policy engine applies retention rules by data category, jurisdiction, and regulatory requirements (e.g., 'customer transaction data: retain 7 years, then delete per tax law'). Automated archival moves inactive data to cost-effective long-term storage tiers while maintaining accessibility for compliance. Intelligent deletion policies automatically purge data at end of retention period unless subject to legal hold. Machine learning identifies candidates for early deletion (duplicate, obsolete, trivial data) to optimize storage costs. Legal hold management system automatically preserves relevant data when litigation or investigation initiated with immutable audit trail. Automated compliance reporting demonstrates retention policy adherence.
dataSources: All enterprise data across storage systems
Retention policies by data category and jurisdiction
Legal hold notices and case data
benefits: 40-60% storage cost reduction through archival and deletion
100% legal hold compliance with automated preservation
Reduced regulatory risk from compliant retention

quickWins: Define and publish formal retention policies by data category
Deploy automated archival for inactive data >1 year old (30% cost savings)
prerequisites: Retention policies defined with legal/compliance input

label: Automated Privacy Impact Assessments (PIA/DPIA)
description: AI-assisted privacy impact assessments with risk scoring, mitigation recommendations, and compliance validation for new systems and processes.

traditional.workflow: Manual Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) or Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) conducted via word documents and interviews. Process takes 4-8 weeks per assessment with heavy legal/compliance involvement. Inconsistent assessment methodology across projects. PIAs often conducted too late in development lifecycle causing costly rework. Limited follow-up to ensure recommended privacy controls are implemented.

agentic.workflow: AI-powered PIA/DPIA platform provides guided questionnaire-based assessments with intelligent question branching based on project characteristics. Machine learning analyzes project data flows, data types, and processing activities to automatically identify privacy risks and assign risk scores. AI-generated risk analysis compares project against GDPR, CCPA, and other regulatory requirements highlighting gaps. Automated mitigation recommendations suggest specific privacy controls (encryption, access controls, data minimization) based on identified risks. Integration with project management tools triggers PIA requirements at project initiation ensuring privacy-by-design. Workflow automation routes assessments to appropriate stakeholders (legal, security, DPO) for review and approval. Continuous monitoring tracks implementation of recommended mitigations with automated follow-up. Reusable assessment templates for common project types (new SaaS integration, new data processing, AI/ML initiative).
dataSources: Project details and data flow documentation
benefits: 70-85% reduction in PIA completion time (1-2 weeks vs 4-8 weeks)
Consistent assessment methodology across all projects

quickWins: Deploy PIA questionnaire templates for common project types (50% time savings)
Integrate PIA triggers into project management workflows (100% coverage)
Implement automated risk scoring and mitigation recommendations
prerequisites: Privacy management platform with PIA module
